page.title: 17Mark's Traditions
page.content: {Fetes,Fairs,Jumble Sales,Harvest {Homes,Harvest Festivals,these}are the very heart of village life and they all thrive here in Mark.The{Harvest {Home}in particular is steeped in tradition.It is "men only" at the sumptuous feast - the women serve the food!1985 is the Centenary Year. 100 years ago it changed its name from Mark Cricket Festival.Many activities take place including Fancy Dress,Tug-of War,Pillow Fights,Cross country,"Lowland Games" There is a traditional{Pig-Roast and {Barn Dance.}The pig is carved by the butcher.There are Dances held in the Halls as well as discos- a new tradition! {Cubs,Scouts,Brownies and Guides}have existed for many years. They work for badges,play games,go on camps and generally learn to be useful and kind.
